subject: Purchase Replacement Brake Module for Simsonn Pedals
description_text:
Hi Simsonn Support,

I recently purchased a used set of Simsonn pedals (throttle, clutch,
brake). The throttle and clutch work perfectly, but the brake pedal does
not register any input in Windows (joy.cpl), your software, or DiView.

I’ve already tested multiple USB ports, rebooted, and confirmed the brake
never shows signal while the other two pedals do, so I believe the load
cell or internal brake wiring has failed.

Could you let me know:

If you sell a replacement brake load cell or brake pedal assembly for this
pedal set

Pricing and availability

Any part number or compatibility details I should know before ordering

I really like the pedals overall and would prefer to keep using them if
possible.

Thanks for your time,
Brendan

conversations.body_text: Hi brendan shuey,     If your pedals are version 1.7.1, you can update the firmware using SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2: Go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals → firmware → pedals-plus.sfu. After the update, the pedals will support the new software. Please test the brake pedal again.  If your pedals are version 1.7.0, you will need to use FreeJoy to calibrate the pedals, and some settings may need to be manually restored.     https://www.simsonn.com/pages/download

Hello,

Thank you for your reply, I really appreciate it. Unfortunately, this
did not work. These are version 1.7.0, so it is not letting me update the
firmware manually. The brake pedal does not have any response within
Freejoy either, so I am unable to calibrate it there. Any suggestions?

Thank you,
Brendan

---

On Wed, Jan 7, 2026, 1:36 AM service @simsonn.com

Hi brendan shuey,     Please use FreeJoy 1.7.0, then load and apply the recovery configuration file (CFG) to try restoring the pedal signal.   https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hnHNudj0VhE6xr7ypu-KeEDuVrlVHVg9/view?usp=drive_link

Hello,

Thank you so much for trying to help me with this problem.

Unfortunately, this fix also did not work. The throttle works, the clutch
works, but I cannot get the brake to work. Two unused axes jitter randomly,
with no correlation to pressing the brake pedal, but I cannot get any input
detected when pressing the brake. Are there any other options that you are
aware of?

Thank you again,
Brendan

--
Brendan J. Shuey
